title: Multimedia Instructional Design and Development: Case-Based Learning Application

context.prior_knowledge: Core instructional design principles and proficiency in digital content creation tools
context.additional_context: Targeting graduate-level language education majors and job-seeking instructional design professionals, the goal is to strengthen multimedia instructional design competencies in an LMS-based asynchronous learning environment.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze real-world multimedia instructional design cases to derive three or more project management strategies.
Learners can critically evaluate diverse media-based instructional design approaches through case-based discussions.
Learners can complete a digital instructional design project integrating peer feedback and iterative improvements using a Learning Management System (LMS).

resources: Digital content authoring tools (e.g., Canva, Articulate 360)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
